title: Squeaky board
data:
| ^ squeaky board [![Squeaky board.png](/images/e/ea/Squeaky_board.png)](/wiki/File:Squeaky_board.png) |                |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------- |
| Generates                                                                                            | Anywhere       |
| Effect                                                                                               | Wakes monsters |

The **squeaky board** is a [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap") that wakes nearby sleeping monsters.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Removal](#Removal)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 Messages](#Messages)
- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Squeaky boards can be generated on most levels. They are also guaranteed on the final level of the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest"), the final level of the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"), certain versions of [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island"), the [Fake Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Fake_Wizard%27s_Tower "Fake Wizard's Tower") and the real [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower").

Each squeaky board has an associated note: it may be any of the following[\[1\]](#cite_note-1):

- "C note"
- "D flat"
- "D note"
- "E flat"
- "E note"
- "F note"
- "F sharp"
- "G note"
- "G sharp"
- "A note"
- "B flat"
- "B note"

No two boards on the same level will squeak with the same note unless there are at least 13 squeaky boards on the level.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Effects

A squeaky board is triggered if you (or a monster) steps on it without [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying") or [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating"). When triggered, the board wakes up nearby monsters.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) [\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

For you, "nearby" means within a distance of √20 × XL[\[5\]](#cite_note-5). (For example, level 5 gives a 10-square radius, level 10 gives 14, and level 15 gives 17.)

For monsters, "nearby" means that the distance is less than √40 (a 6-square radius)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6).

## Removal

Squeaky boards can be untrapped using the #untrap command. You must select a [potion of oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil") (which will be consumed) or a charged [can of grease](/wiki/Can_of_grease "Can of grease") (one charge will be consumed). A successful repair grants 1 [experience point](/wiki/Experience_point "Experience point").[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Strategy

Since squeaky boards do not directly cause damage, they are often harmless. However stepping on a squeaky board can potentially wake up the monsters in a [treasure zoo](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo") or similar [special rooms](/wiki/Special_room "Special room"), causing them to seek you out before you are ready to fight them. On the special levels where they are guaranteed, squeaky boards can often wake up enemies such as [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa"), the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") and [Ashikaga Takauji](/wiki/Ashikaga_Takauji "Ashikaga Takauji") (who will wield the [Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "Tsurugi of Muramasa") and possibly bisect you if he wakes up).

The unique note of a squeaky board can potentially help you pinpoint a monster's location.

Untrapping a squeaky board is probably not worth it, as there are better uses for both oil and grease.

## History

Squeaky boards were added in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

The ability to distinguish boards by note was added in 2006[\[8\]](#cite_note-8). It was inspired by the encyclopedia entry, which was included much earlier. The feature existed in the [leaked development version](/wiki/Leaked_development_version "Leaked development version"), where it was listed as "multiple squeaks for squeaky boards" in the changelog. The feature was officially released in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Messages

- You notice a loose board below you.

  You were flying or levitating over a squeaky board, and did not trigger it.

- You notice a crease in the linoleum.

  As above, but you were [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

- A board beneath you squeaks \<note> loudly.

  You stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, possibly waking nearby monsters.

- A board beneath you vibrates.

  As above, but you were [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf").

- A board beneath \<monster> squeaks \<note> loudly.

  A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it.

- \<monster> stops momentarily and appears to cringe.

  As above, but you were deaf.

- - You hear a \<note> squeak loudly.
  - You hear a \<note> squeak in the distance.

  A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, but it was outside your line of sight.

## Encyclopedia entry

A floorboard creaked. Galder had spent many hours tuning them, always a wise precaution with an ambitious assistant who walked like a cat.  
D flat. That meant he was just to the right of the door. "Ah, Trymon," he said, without turning, and noted with some satisfaction the faint indrawing of breath behind him. "Good of you to come. Shut the door, will you?"

\[ The Light Fantastic, by Terry Pratchett ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1566](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/trap.c#L1566)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 356](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/trap.c#L356)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1054](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/mon.c#L1054): *Effect on player*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 2263](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/mon.c#L2263): *Effect on monsters*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3046](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/mon.c#L3046)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3053](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/mon.c#L3053)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4236](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/trap.c#L4236)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) <https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ab947c6b651df8f4dd7fbd79bb3d4dedd8a405c1>

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Squeaky board

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
^ squeaky board
Generates Anywhere
Effect Wakes monsters

The squeaky board is a trap that wakes nearby sleeping monsters.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Effects
  • 3 Removal
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 History
  • 6 Messages
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

Squeaky boards can be generated on most levels. They are also guaranteed on the final level of the Samurai quest, the final level of the Valkyrie quest, certain versions of Medusa's Island, the Fake Wizard's Tower and the real Wizard's Tower.

Each squeaky board has an associated note: it may be any of the following[1]:

  • "C note"
  • "D flat"
  • "D note"
  • "E flat"
  • "E note"
  • "F note"
  • "F sharp"
  • "G note"
  • "G sharp"
  • "A note"
  • "B flat"
  • "B note"

No two boards on the same level will squeak with the same note unless there are at least 13 squeaky boards on the level.[2]

Effects

A squeaky board is triggered if you (or a monster) steps on it without flying or levitating. When triggered, the board wakes up nearby monsters.[3] [4]

For you, "nearby" means within a distance of √20 × XL[5]. (For example, level 5 gives a 10-square radius, level 10 gives 14, and level 15 gives 17.)

For monsters, "nearby" means that the distance is less than √40 (a 6-square radius)[6].

Removal

Squeaky boards can be untrapped using the #untrap command. You must select a potion of oil (which will be consumed) or a charged can of grease (one charge will be consumed). A successful repair grants 1 experience point.[7]

Strategy

Since squeaky boards do not directly cause damage, they are often harmless. However stepping on a squeaky board can potentially wake up the monsters in a treasure zoo or similar special rooms, causing them to seek you out before you are ready to fight them. On the special levels where they are guaranteed, squeaky boards can often wake up enemies such as Medusa, the Wizard of Yendor and Ashikaga Takauji (who will wield the Tsurugi of Muramasa and possibly bisect you if he wakes up).

The unique note of a squeaky board can potentially help you pinpoint a monster's location.

Untrapping a squeaky board is probably not worth it, as there are better uses for both oil and grease.

History

Squeaky boards were added in NetHack 1.3d.

The ability to distinguish boards by note was added in 2006[8]. It was inspired by the encyclopedia entry, which was included much earlier. The feature existed in the leaked development version, where it was listed as "multiple squeaks for squeaky boards" in the changelog. The feature was officially released in NetHack 3.6.0.

Messages

You notice a loose board below you.
You were flying or levitating over a squeaky board, and did not trigger it.
You notice a crease in the linoleum.
As above, but you were hallucinating.
A board beneath you squeaks <note> loudly.
You stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, possibly waking nearby monsters.
A board beneath you vibrates.
As above, but you were deaf.
A board beneath <monster> squeaks <note> loudly.
A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it.
<monster> stops momentarily and appears to cringe.
As above, but you were deaf.
You hear a <note> squeak loudly.
You hear a <note> squeak in the distance.
A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, but it was outside your line of sight.

Encyclopedia entry

A floorboard creaked. Galder had spent many hours tuning them, always a wise precaution with an ambitious assistant who walked like a cat.
D flat. That meant he was just to the right of the door. "Ah, Trymon," he said, without turning, and noted with some satisfaction the faint indrawing of breath behind him. "Good of you to come. Shut the door, will you?"

[ The Light Fantastic, by Terry Pratchett ]

References

  1. ↑ src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1566
  2. ↑ src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 356
  3. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1054: Effect on player
  4. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 2263: Effect on monsters
  5. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3046
  6. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3053
  7. ↑ src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4236
  8. ↑ https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ab947c6b651df8f4dd7fbd79bb3d4dedd8a405c1

{{trap |name=squeaky board |color=brown |generation=Anywhere |effect=Wakes monsters }} The '''squeaky board''' is a [[trap]] that wakes nearby sleeping monsters. ==Generation== Squeaky boards can be generated on most levels. They are also guaranteed on the final level of the [[Samurai quest]], the final level of the [[Valkyrie quest]], certain versions of [[Medusa's Island]], the [[Fake Wizard's Tower]] and the real [[Wizard's Tower]]. Each squeaky board has an associated note: it may be any of the following{{refsrc|src/trap.c|1566|version=NetHack 3.6.6}}:
* "C note" * "D flat" * "D note" * "E flat" * "E note" * "F note" * "F sharp" * "G note" * "G sharp" * "A note" * "B flat" * "B note"
No two boards on the same level will squeak with the same note unless there are at least 13 squeaky boards on the level.{{refsrc|src/trap.c|356|version=NetHack 3.6.6}} ==Effects== A squeaky board is triggered if you (or a monster) steps on it without [[flying]] or [[levitating]]. When triggered, the board wakes up nearby monsters.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|1054|version=NetHack 3.6.6|comment=Effect on player}} {{refsrc|src/mon.c|2263|version=NetHack 3.6.6|comment=Effect on monsters}} For you, "nearby" means within a distance of √20 × XL{{refsrc|src/mon.c|3046|version=NetHack 3.6.6}}. (For example, level 5 gives a 10-square radius, level 10 gives 14, and level 15 gives 17.) For monsters, "nearby" means that the distance is less than √40 (a 6-square radius){{refsrc|src/mon.c|3053|version=NetHack 3.6.6}}. ==Removal== Squeaky boards can be untrapped using the #untrap command. You must select a [[potion of oil]] (which will be consumed) or a charged [[can of grease]] (one charge will be consumed). A successful repair grants 1 [[experience point]].{{refsrc|src/trap.c|4236|nethack=3.6.7}} ==Strategy== Since squeaky boards do not directly cause damage, they are often harmless. However stepping on a squeaky board can potentially wake up the monsters in a [[treasure zoo]] or similar [[special room]]s, causing them to seek you out before you are ready to fight them. On the special levels where they are guaranteed, squeaky boards can often wake up enemies such as [[Medusa]], the [[Wizard of Yendor]] and [[Ashikaga Takauji]] (who will wield the [[Tsurugi of Muramasa]] and possibly bisect you if he wakes up). The unique note of a squeaky board can potentially help you pinpoint a monster's location. Untrapping a squeaky board is probably not worth it, as there are better uses for both oil and grease. ==History== Squeaky boards were added in [[NetHack 1.3d]]. The ability to distinguish boards by note was added in 2006https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ab947c6b651df8f4dd7fbd79bb3d4dedd8a405c1. It was inspired by the encyclopedia entry, which was included much earlier. The feature existed in the [[leaked development version]], where it was listed as "multiple squeaks for squeaky boards" in the changelog. The feature was officially released in [[NetHack 3.6.0]]. ==Messages== {{message|You notice a loose board below you.|You were flying or levitating over a squeaky board, and did not trigger it.}} {{message|You notice a crease in the linoleum.|As above, but you were [[hallucinating]].}} {{message|A board beneath you squeaks loudly.|You stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, possibly waking nearby monsters.}} {{message|A board beneath you vibrates.|As above, but you were [[deaf]].}} {{message|A board beneath squeaks loudly.|A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it.}} {{message| stops momentarily and appears to cringe.|As above, but you were deaf.}} {{message|You hear a squeak loudly.}} {{message|You hear a squeak in the distance.|A monster stepped on a squeaky board and triggered it, but it was outside your line of sight.}} ==Encyclopedia entry== {{encyclopedia| A floorboard creaked. Galder had spent many hours tuning them, always a wise precaution with an ambitious assistant who walked like a cat. D flat. That meant he was just to the right of the door. "Ah, Trymon," he said, without turning, and noted with some satisfaction the faint indrawing of breath behind him. "Good of you to come. Shut the door, will you?" |[ The Light Fantastic, by Terry Pratchett ] }} ==References== [[Category:Traps]] {{nethack-366}}
